image.altText: A side by side image of Trump in a suit raising a thumb and Biden in a suit.

props.synopsis: The historic debate between the two US presidential hopefuls was full of jabs and incoherent speech. Here are the key takeaways.

title.children: Bumble and bluster: Key takeaways from Biden and Trump's first 2024 presidential debate

image.altText: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris laughing and clasping hands

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's poor debate performance has resulted in cries from within his party to replace him as a candidate in the United States presidential election.

title.children: A 'disaster' debate performance stirs Democratic panic about Biden's candidacy

image.altText: A man in glasses wearing a tie.

props.synopsis: An emotional Anthony Albanese has revealed that an accused teenage terrorist's manifesto allegedly included direct threats on his family.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says he was threatened in accused teen terrorist's manifesto

image.altText: A man wearing cold weather gear standing amongst a town covered in snow

props.synopsis: A Perth man is released on strict bail conditions after appearing in court accused of starting up "evil twin" wi-fi networks, to get the personal details of users at multiple locations, including airports across Australia.

title.children: Perth man allegedly set up fake wi-fi networks to steal people's personal data at airports

image.altText: A police sign surrounded by trees, with the Aboriginal flag behind it

props.synopsis: WA's Corruption and Crime Commission declares police efforts to investigate its own officers were "inadequate" after the "unlawful and unjust" arrest of an Indigenous teen.

title.children: CCC delivers scathing findings against WA Police after forceful arrest of 14-year-old Indigenous girl

image.altText: Josh Dunkley dives to tackle Caleb Windsor

props.synopsis: Brisbane welcomes Will Ashcroft back into the side after a long injury lay off as the Lions tackle Melbourne in a game critical to both teams' finals hopes. Follow our live blog.

title.children: Demons' goal rush sparks hopes of an upset win over Lions at the Gabba

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: LIONS WIN! They've done the Demons by five points!
Hugh McCluggage from the boundary! Has he won the game?!?
3QT: The Demons lead the Lions by just 15 points

image.altText: A motion blur image of rat tests being thrown in a bin

props.synopsis: The WA government is set to fork out millions destroying around 19 million expired rapid antigen tests that are sitting in a warehouse, but is defending the move and the purchase of the tests as "a good use of taxpayers' money".

title.children: After ordering more COVID tests than any other state, WA is now spending $4m to bin them

image.altText: Large rings float in the ocean with a coastline in the background.

props.synopsis: Tassal wants to multiply its west Kimberley barramundi farming by more than tenfold in a proposal that has been scaled back from a previous bid.

title.children: Seafood giant Tassal proposes 84 new fish ponds in remote Kimberley waterways

image.altText: Crystal clear blue water laps upon red rocky shores

props.synopsis: The Pilbara's Balla Balla River is known for its barramundi fishing but could soon be home to a nearby sea water desalination plant worth $5 billion.

title.children: Nearby this remote river could become home to WA's largest desalination plant

image.altText: A man walking with children in a field of grass.

props.synopsis: These charts show how Australian households are beginning to change as people decide to delay having children, or opt out completely.

title.children: Single dads are projected to grow by almost 70 per cent over the next 20 years

image.altText: An image composite showing Donald Trump speaking and Joe Biden responding.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump conclude their debate in Atlanta, Georgia — and pundits are united in their view that it was a bad night for the president. Take a look back at how the debate unfolded.

title.children: Biden stumbles as Trump deflects in 'game-changing' presidential debate — as it happened

image.altText: Group of men stand arm-in-arm smiling atop a mountain in Kyrgyzstan. Clear day with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: It's a long, steep and winding road for Australia's Olympic wrestlers as they train in the remote mountains of Kyrgyzstan with eyes on gold in Paris.

title.children: Meet the Aussie wrestlers training for the Olympics in rural Kyrgyzstan

image.altText: Man in Australian basketball uniform holding ball with defender in blue

props.synopsis: The basketballer from country Western Australia signs a contract with Oklahoma City Thunder in the NBA after missing out on draft night.

title.children: Former country WA basketballer Alex Ducas lands NBA deal

image.altText: an aerial shot of a housing estate

props.synopsis: ABS data reveals a big lift in household wealth driven by Australia's white-hot property market.

title.children: Millions of property owners just made $25,000 without lifting a finger

image.altText: bus veered off the road

props.synopsis: A Broome family escapes serious injury after a bus crashed through their backyard into their lounge room.

title.children: Lucky escape for driver and family after bus crashes through backyard

image.altText: A car crushed by a fallen roof.

props.synopsis: A roof collapses at a departure terminal at the main airport in India's capital, New Delhi, killing one person and causing authorities to cancel flights from one terminal.

title.children: Roof collapses at Delhi Airport, one dead, several injured

image.altText: A still from a video shows Greg Lynn sitting at a desk in a police station.

props.synopsis: Newly released police tapes reveal how Greg Lynn explained the deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill to officers during the interview in which he was charged with their murders.

title.children: Watch how Greg Lynn explained campers' deaths to police after his arrest during murder investigation

image.altText: Joshua Patrick and his Mum

props.synopsis: It's estimated about one in six Australian children grow up in poverty but, without an official poverty line, advocates say the government is flying blind on a crucial issue.

title.children: This family is struggling to get by. Why don't we know how many are like them?

image.altText: Nine News entertainment network logo

props.synopsis: In announcing 200 job losses on Friday, Nine Entertainment has joined other commercial media outlets in feeling the chill from a cooling economy as more corporate budgets slash their marketing spend.

title.children: A chill wind is blowing through the media and it could be a warning sign for everyone

image.altText: A close up image of a baby sleeping, his eyes are closed and he is lying on one arm.

props.synopsis: Maria thought she was doing the right thing by connecting with the sperm donor she used to conceive her baby. She now wants the clinic to warn other families.

title.children: Maria used a sperm donor to have her son. Then the man tracked her down

image.altText: A hand holds brilliant white fertiliser while a truck tips it off in the background

props.synopsis: A WA-based gas company's plans to make 1.4 million tonnes of urea per annum from clean hydrogen and natural gas, which attracted the interest of farmers, will now focus on producing electricity instead near Three Springs.

title.children: Strike Energy's $3b project to supply essential farming fertiliser shelved for gas power plant

image.altText: bullock chalmers

props.synopsis: A rate rise as soon as August is now a distinct possibility, and will make the government's cost-of-living pitch more complicated.

title.children: Is one more rate rise now on the horizon, and could it sink the government?

image.altText: An illustration of a woman swimming in a pool in the Australian bush

props.synopsis: House-sitting platforms are connecting sitters and home owners for a fee. But who's responsible when things go wrong?

title.children: 'We keep finding things that are not right': Should you trust a house-sitter from the internet?

image.altText: A woman smiles

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man is charged with murder after police found the body of a woman at a home in Russell Lea.

title.children: Man charged with murdering housemate at home in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: A headshot of a woman in front of a textured orange backdrop

props.synopsis: After 18 months awaiting trial for allegedly trying to import 2 kilograms of methamphetamine into Japan, WA grandmother Donna Nelson is allowed to spend time with her three-year-old granddaughter.

title.children: 'That's hostage justice': Lawyer's fears for Australian woman charged with drug importation in Japan

image.altText: a sign reading "FIGHT THE BITE" tied to a fence in Port Hedland.

props.synopsis: Residents and tourists are urged to take precautions after two people died after contracting Murray Valley Encephalitis in WA's Pilbara.

title.children: Health alert issued after mosquito-borne virus kills two people in northern Western Australia

image.altText: A close up of Jarryd Hayne with his hand on his chin

props.synopsis: The Crown said in court that it would take no further proceedings against Jarryd Hayne and his bail conditions were discontinued.

title.children: Former NRL star Hayne speaks publicly for first time since successful sexual assault appeal

image.altText: Sepia image of woman holding bald-headed baby

props.synopsis: For families in Darwin, the chance of sleep on Christmas Eve in 1974 vanished as they endured one of the worst natural disasters in the country. Fifty years on, one couple shares the "miracle" that kept their infant son alive as the cyclone raged around them.

title.children: Cyclone Tracy blew Pam and her baby out of their home. An ordinary object helped keep him alive

image.altText: Rubbish on the floor of a home.

props.synopsis: A baby who died in squalid conditions on a fold-out couch at a home in regional SA would have been removed from the property days earlier if child protection authorities had responded to an early warning, a coronial inquest concludes.

title.children: Death of 11-week-old in squalor followed 'significant missed opportunity' for intervention

image.altText: A woman smiles in the background while putting a coin in a pink piggy bank which is in focus.

props.synopsis: Do you shop around when your insurance company or energy supplier sends you a bill with increased prices? If not, you might be missing out on savings.

title.children: You can save hundreds in a few hours by ticking off these financial housekeeping tasks

image.altText: A brown and light brown banded snake underwater on a bed of small white rocks

props.synopsis: The last stronghold of a sea snake slated for an endangered species listing sits atop Australia's largest undeveloped gas field.

title.children: Rare sea snake lives in a WA reef near where Woodside proposes to drill for gas

image.altText: A man in suit gets out of a ca r

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese needs to take the win and move on from the successful negotiation of Julian Assange's freedom. The issue could become sticky fly paper and with troubling inflation and Senator Fatima Payman voting across party lines, he now has other problems to tackle.

title.children: The Assange light and sound show overshadows government problems but it can't last

image.altText: A Palestinian man reacts as he says goodbye to his sick daughter

props.synopsis: Tears and relief as sick and wounded children are among 68 people who have been medically evacuated from the Gaza Strip so they can have treatment abroad, marking the first medical evacuation in nearly two months.

title.children: Sick and injured children medically evacuated from Gaza for first time in months

image.altText: A visualisation of two asteroids floating in space. Earth is visible in the distance.

props.synopsis: Two asteroids — including one that's newly-discovered — are passing Earth this week. Here's what to know and how to spot them in the night sky.

title.children: Two large asteroids are passing Earth this week. Here's how to spot them
